param.option: Use a genome from the history

param.name: genotype_likelihood_computation_type_selector
param.label: Genotype Likelihood Computation
param.option: Do not perform genotype likelihood computation (output pileup)

param.name: output_tags
param.label: Optional (FORMAT/INFO) tags to output
param.option: AD (Allelic depth on forward strand, FORMAT)
AD (Total allelic depth on forward strand, INFO)
AD (Allelic depth on reverse strand, FORMAT)
AD (Total allelic depth on reverse strand, INFO)

param.name: perform_indel_calling_selector
param.label: Perform INDEL calling
param.option: Perform INDEL calling using default options
Perform INDEL calling and set advanced options

param.name: gap_open_sequencing_error_probability
param.label: Phred-scaled gap open sequencing error probability
param.help: Reducing this value leads to more indel calls

param.name: gap_extension_sequencing_error_probability
param.label: Phred-scaled gap extension sequencing error probability
param.help: Reducing this value leads to longer indels

param.name: skip_indel_calling_above_sample_depth
param.label: Skip INDEL calling if the average per-sample depth is above

param.name: minimum_gapped_reads_for_indel_candidates
param.label: Minimum gapped reads for indel candidates

param.name: gapped_read_per_sample
param.label: Apply --min-ireads and --gap-frac values on a per-sample basis
param.help: By default both options are applied to reads pooled from all samples

param.name: platform_entry
param.label: Platform to use for INDEL candidates
param.help: It is recommended to collect indel candidates from sequencing technologies that have low indel error rate such as ILLUMINA

param.name: output_read_names
param.label: Output an extra column containing comma-separated read names. (--output-QNAME)

param.name: output_all_pos
param.label: Output all/absolutely all positions
param.help: Output all positions, including those with zero depth. (-a) Output absolutely all positions, including unused reference sequences (-aa). Note that when used in conjunction with a BED file the -a option may sometimes operate as if -aa was specified if the reference sequence has coverage outside of the region specified in the BED file.

param.name: filter_flags
param.label: Set filter by flags
param.option: Filter by flags to exclude or require

param.name: limit_by_regions
param.label: Select regions to call
param.option: Paste a list of regions or BED

param.name: region_paste
param.label: Regions
param.help: Paste a list of regions in BED format or as a list of chromosomes and positions

param.name: exclude_read_groups
param.label: Select read groups to exclude
param.option: Paste a list of read groups

param.name: group_paste
param.label: Read groups
param.help: Paste a list of read groups

param.name: skip_anomalous_read_pairs
param.label: Do not skip anomalous read pairs in variant calling

param.name: disable_probabilistic_realignment
param.label: Disable probabilistic realignment for the computation of base alignment quality (BAQ)
param.help: BAQ is the Phred-scaled probability of a read base being misaligned. Applying this option greatly helps to reduce false SNPs caused by misalignments

param.name: coefficient_for_downgrading
param.label: Coefficient for downgrading mapping quality for reads containing excessive mismatches
param.help: Given a read with a phred-scaled probability q of being generated from the mapped position, the new mapping quality is about sqrt((INT-q)/INT)*INT. A zero value disables this functionality; if enabled, the recommended value for BWA is 50

param.name: minimum_mapping_quality
param.label: Minimum mapping quality for an alignment to be used

param.name: minimum_base_quality
param.label: Minimum base quality for a base to be considered

param.name: region_string
param.label: Only generate pileup in region
param.help: If used in conjunction with --positions, then considers the intersection of the two requests. Defaults to all sites

tool.help:
**What it does**
Report variants for one or multiple BAM files. Alignment records are grouped by sample identifiers in @RG header lines. If sample identifiers are absent, each input file is regarded as one sample.
**Notes**: Assuming diploid individuals.
